prompt_text:
You are an expert dataset generator for bilingual English–Mandarin code-switched technical dialogues. 
Act as a frontend engineer from Shanghai now working in San Francisco. You naturally mix English technical terms into Mandarin sentences, 
and sometimes switch whole phrases to English when it feels natural. Keep the tone pragmatic, casual, like real engineers chatting.
Few-shot examples:
Example 1:
A: "Can you push the latest styles to staging?"
B: "可以，我现在就 push. 不过 header 在 mobile 上看起来有点 weird."
Example 2:
A: "There's a bug in the login flow after the OAuth change."
B: "看一下 redirect URI, scope 好像没有 properly 设置."
Example 3:
A: "We need to ship before Friday's deadline."
B: "好，先 prioritize login 和 checkout, 其他功能可以等下个 sprint."
Now: produce a dialogue between two engineers (Li and Sarah). Each dialogue should be 5–7 turns.
Requirements:
Use **English–Mandarin code-switching** at the **phrase level**.
Include at least one trigger word: **deploy, build, bug, deadline, merge**.
Target ~35–50% Mandarin tokens per dialogue.
Use natural engineering register (issue, PR, deploy, QA, staging, workaround).
Keep turns short-to-medium.
Output only the dialogues. Do not repeat the few-shot examples.

Sarah: "明白，我会先进行 deploy，然后通知你测试结果。"

Li: "谢谢你的配合，我们一起加油吧！"

prompt_text:
You are an expert dataset generator for workplace English dialogues between software engineers. 
Act as Sarah, a frontend engineer in San Francisco, chatting with Li, a backend engineer from Shanghai who speaks fluent English. 
Keep the entire conversation in English (no Chinese characters). 
The tone should sound like Slack or hallway conversation — short, technical turns about debugging, deploying, or merging code.
Include at least one of these trigger words: deploy, build, bug, deadline, merge.
Few-shot examples:
A: “Can you push the fix to staging?”
B: “Yeah, I’ll deploy right after lunch.”
A: “Cool, I’ll run QA on the build then.”
Now: produce a 5–7 turn dialogue between Li and Sarah, fully in English.
Output only the dialogue.

Li: Will do. Should be ready in the next 20 minutes.
Sarah: Perfect, I'll start building the new version in the meantime.
Li: Sounds good. We have a tight deadline for this sprint, so let's make sure everything is tested thoroughly.
Sarah: Agreed, quality is key. Let's aim to deploy before EOD.
Li: Absolutely, I'll prioritize getting this bug fixed ASAP.

prompt_text:
You are a senior software engineer roleplaying natural English workplace chat. 
Li and Sarah are discussing a merge conflict and deployment blockers. 
Keep the tone pragmatic and realistic — no Chinese text at all. 
Use natural conversational phrasing like "staging build" or "hotfix".
Each dialogue should be 5–7 turns long and include one of: deploy, build, bug, deadline, merge.
Output only the conversation.

prompt_text:
你是一位擅长生成中文职场对话的数据集专家。请模拟两个软件工程师（李伟 和 王珊）的真实对话。
整个对话必须使用中文（不要夹杂任何英文单词或代码混合）。
语气自然，像同事在公司聊天。讨论内容包括部署、构建、修复漏洞或赶项目截止日期。
Few-shot 示例：
A: “你那边构建完了吗？我准备合并到主分支。”
B: “还没，我先跑一下测试，等会儿再部署。”
现在生成一个 5–7 轮的中文对话，只输出对话内容。

utterance:

王珊：好的，我马上过来看看。你先把这个分支部署一下，我看看运行情况。
李伟：我马上部署一下，你要是找到问题了就帮我修复一下吧。
王珊：好的，我先跑一下测试，看看是不是在特定环境下出现的问题。
李伟：好的，谢谢你。这个 bug 确实很棘手，赶项目截止日期，我们得尽快解决。

整个对话必须使用中文（不要夹杂任何英文单词或代码混合）。
语气自然，像同事在公司聊天。讨论内容包括部署、构建、修复漏洞或赶项目截止日期。
Few-shot 示例：
A: “你那边构建完了吗？我准备合并到主分支。”
B: “还没，我先跑一下测试，等会儿再部署。”
现在生成一个 5–7 轮的中文对话，只输出对话内容。

utterance:
李伟：“嘿，王珊，你那边的项目进展得怎么样？快到截止日期了。”

王珊：“还不错，不过有几个漏洞需要修复，明天就要部署了。”

李伟：“你需要我帮忙吗？我可以抽时间来看看那些漏洞。”

王珊：“谢谢！其实有一个漏洞比较棘手，涉及到数据迁移的部分。”

李伟：“哦，那确实麻烦。如果你今天有空，我们可以一起debug。”

王珊：“好主意！我们先看看构建的日志，再分析一下。”

李伟：“好的，我这边也在整理一下文档，准备在部署前明确一下每个功能的实现。”

王珊：“完美！希望能够顺利按时上线。”

Act as Sarah, a frontend engineer in San Francisco, chatting with Li, a backend engineer from Shanghai who speaks fluent English. 
Keep the entire conversation in English (no Chinese characters). 
The tone should sound like Slack or hallway conversation — short, technical turns about debugging, deploying, or merging code.
Include at least one of these trigger words: deploy, build, bug, deadline, merge.
Few-shot examples:
A: “Can you push the fix to staging?”
B: “Yeah, I’ll deploy right after lunch.”
A: “Cool, I’ll run QA on the build then.”
Now: produce a 5–7 turn dialogue between Li and Sarah, fully in English.
Output only the dialogue.

utterance:
Li: Hey Sarah, I'm running into a merge conflict with the latest feature branch. Have you had a chance to look at it?

Sarah: Hey Li, I haven't seen that yet. Let me check it out.

Li: Thanks, I appreciate it. We really need to get this resolved soon with the deadline approaching.

Sarah: I agree, we can't afford any delays. I'll work on resolving the conflict and get back to you.

Li: Great, let me know if you need any help. Once we have this sorted, we can deploy the staging build for testing.

Sarah: Definitely, I'll get it sorted as soon as possible. Hopefully, it won't cause any deployment blockers.

Li: Fingers crossed. Let's aim to get this sorted before EOD so we can deploy first thing tomorrow.

Sarah: Sounds like a plan. I'll keep you updated on my progress and we'll aim to have a clean build ready for deployment.

Keep the tone pragmatic and realistic — no Chinese text at all. 
Use natural conversational phrasing like "staging build" or "hotfix".
Each dialogue should be 5–7 turns long and include one of: deploy, build, bug, deadline, merge.
Output only the conversation.

prompt_text:
你是资深后端工程师李伟，正在和前端同事王珊聊天。
整个对话请保持纯中文（不要出现任何英文技术词汇），语气要真实自然，像同事在讨论工作问题。
话题可以包括构建、部署、修复漏洞、合并代码或赶项目截止日期。
生成一个 5–7 轮的中文对话，只输出对话内容。

李伟：对，合并的时候最好先拉取最新的代码，确保本地的代码是最新的，避免冲突。

王珊：好的，我知道了。对了，项目截止日期快到了，我们是不是需要加班赶一下进度？

李伟：是啊，可能需要大家一起加把劲，确保按时上线。加油！

prompt_text:
You are an expert dataset generator for bilingual English–Mandarin code-switched technical dialogues. 
Act as a frontend engineer from Shanghai now working in San Francisco. You naturally mix English technical terms into Mandarin sentences, 
and sometimes switch whole phrases to English when it feels natural. Keep the tone pragmatic, casual, like real engineers chatting.
Few-shot examples:
Example 1:
A: "Can you push the latest styles to staging?"
B: "可以，我现在就 push. 不过 header 在 mobile 上看起来有点 weird."
Example 2:
A: "There's a bug in the login flow after the OAuth change."
B: "看一下 redirect URI, scope 好像没有 properly 设置."
Example 3:
A: "We need to ship before Friday's deadline."
B: "好，先 prioritize login 和 checkout, 其他功能可以等下个 sprint."
Now: produce a dialogue between two engineers (Li and Sarah). Each dialogue should be 5–7 turns.
Requirements:
Use **English–Mandarin code-switching** at the **phrase level**.
Include at least one trigger word: **deploy, build, bug, deadline, merge**.
Target ~35–50% Mandarin tokens per dialogue.
Use natural engineering register (issue, PR, deploy, QA, staging, workaround).
Keep turns short-to-medium.
Output only the dialogues. Do not repeat the few-shot examples.

Sarah: "当然可以，我现在正忙着 debug 一个 bug, 等我一下."
Li: "没问题，我等你. 听说我们要在这周五之前 deploy 新 feature."
Sarah: "对啊，deadline 很紧, 我们要确保 QA 过了才能 merge."
Li: "我有个 workaround 可以先解决一部分 bug, 你看怎么样?"
Sarah: "好主意! 我们可以先 fix 这些问题, 然后再继续 debug 其他的 bug."

Act as a frontend engineer from Shanghai now working in San Francisco. You naturally mix English technical terms into Mandarin sentences, 
and sometimes switch whole phrases to English when it feels natural. Keep the tone pragmatic, casual, like real engineers chatting.
Few-shot examples:
Example 1:
A: "Can you push the latest styles to staging?"
B: "可以，我现在就 push. 不过 header 在 mobile 上看起来有点 weird."
Example 2:
A: "There's a bug in the login flow after the OAuth change."
B: "看一下 redirect URI, scope 好像没有 properly 设置."
Example 3:
A: "We need to ship before Friday's deadline."
B: "好，先 prioritize login 和 checkout, 其他功能可以等下个 sprint."
Now: produce a dialogue between two engineers (Li and Sarah). Each dialogue should be 5–7 turns.
Requirements:
Use **English–Mandarin code-switching** at the **phrase level**.
Include at least one trigger word: **deploy, build, bug, deadline, merge**.
Target ~35–50% Mandarin tokens per dialogue.
Use natural engineering register (issue, PR, deploy, QA, staging, workaround).
Keep turns short-to-medium.
Output only the dialogues. Do not repeat the few-shot examples.

utterance:
Li: "Sarah, can you merge my PR into master?"
Sarah: "好的，我看一下 code review comments 先."
Li: "Great, let me know if you need me to make any changes."
Sarah: "没问题，我觉得这个 feature 可以 deploy 到 staging 环境测试一下."
Li: "Sounds good, I'll build the latest version and deploy it."
Sarah: "有个 bug 我在 staging 找到了，需要一个 workaround."
Li: "Got it, I'll take a look and fix it before the deadline."
